title: nf-core/scflow pipeline parameters
description: Complete analysis workflow for single-cell/nuclei RNA-sequencing data.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: The .tsv file specifying sample matrix filepaths.

ensembl_mappings.description: Optional tsv file containing mappings between ensembl_gene_id's and gene_names's

ctd_path.help_text: This is a zip file containing cell-type annotation reference files for the EWCE package.

celltype_mappings.description: Optional tsv file specifying manual revisions of cell-type annotations.

reddim_genes_yml.description: Optional list of genes of interest in YML format for plotting of gene expression.

qc_key_colname.description: The sample sheet column name with unique sample identifiers.

qc_factor_vars.description: The sample sheet variables to treat as factors.
qc_factor_vars.help_text: All sample sheet columns with numbers which should be treated as factors should be specified here separated by commas.   Examples include columns with dates, numeric sample identifiers, etc.

qc_min_ribo.description: Minimum proportion of counts mapping to ribosomal genes.

qc_max_ribo.description: Maximum proportion of counts mapping to ribosomal genes.

qc_max_mito.description: Maximum proportion of counts mapping to mitochondrial genes.

qc_nmads.description: The number of MADs for outlier detection.
qc_nmads.help_text: The number of median absolute deviations (MADs) used to define outliers for adaptive thresholding.

ambient_rna_profiling.title: Ambient RNA Profiling
ambient_rna_profiling.description: Options for profiling ambient RNA/empty droplets.

amb_find_cells.description: Enable ambient RNA / empty droplet profiling.

amb_retain.help_text: A numeric scalar specifying the threshold for the total UMI count above which all barcodes are assumed to contain cells, or "auto" for automated estimation based on the data.
amb_retain.description: Upper UMI counts threshold for true cell annotation.

amb_lower.help_text: A numeric scalar specifying the lower bound on the total UMI count, at or below which all barcodes are assumed to correspond to empty droplets.
amb_lower.description: Lower UMI counts threshold for empty droplet annotation.

amb_alpha_cutoff.description: The maximum FDR for the emptyDrops algorithm.

amb_niters.help_text: An integer scalar specifying the number of iterations to use for the Monte Carlo p-value calculations for the emptyDrops algorithm.
amb_niters.description: Number of Monte Carlo p-value iterations.

amb_expect_cells.description: Expected number of cells per sample.
amb_expect_cells.help_text: If the "retain" parameter is set to "auto" (recommended), then this parameter is used to identify the optimal value for "retain" for the emptyDrops algorithm.

mult_singlets_method.description: Algorithm to use for doublet/multiplet identification.

mult_vars_to_regress_out.description: Variables to regress out for dimensionality reduction.

mult_pca_dims.description: Number of PCA dimensions to use.

mult_var_features.description: The top n most variable features to use.

mult_doublet_rate.help_text: Use a fixed default rate (e.g. 0.075 to specify that 7.5% of all cells should be marked as doublets), or set to 0 to use the "dpk" method (recommended).

mult_dpk.help_text: The doublets per thousand cell increment specifies the expected doublet rate based on the number of cells, i.e. with a dpk of 8 (recommended by 10X), a dataset with 1000 cells is expected to contain 8 doublets per thousand cells, a dataset with 2000 cells is expected to contain 16 doublets per thousand cells, and a dataset with 10000 cells is expected to contain 80 cells per thousand cells (or 800 doublets in total).  If the "doublet_rate" parameter is manually specified this recommended incremental behaviour is overridden.

mult_pK.description: Specify a pK value instead of parameter sweep.
mult_pK.help_text: The optimal pK value used by the doubletFinder algorithm is determined following a compute-intensive parameter sweep.  The parameter sweep can be overridden by manually specifying a pK value.

merge.title: Merge
merge.description: Parameters used in the merged quality-control report.

merge_plot_vars.help_text: A comma-separated list of numeric variables which differ between individual cells of each sample.  The merged sample report will include plots facilitating between-sample comparisons for each of these numeric variables.

merge_facet_vars.description: Categorical variables for further sub-setting of plots
merge_facet_vars.help_text: A comma-separated list of categorical variables.  The merged sample report will include additional plots of sample metrics subset by each of these variables (e.g. sex, diagnosis).

merge_outlier_vars.help_text: The merged report will include tables highlighting samples that are putative outliers for each of these numeric variables.

integration.title: Integration
integration.description: Parameters for integrating datasets and batch correction.

integ_take_gene_union.description: Fill out matrices with union of genes.
integ_take_gene_union.help_text: See rliger::createLiger().  Whether to fill out raw.data matrices with union of genes across all datasets (filling in 0 for missing data) (requires make.sparse = TRUE) (default FALSE).

integ_remove_missing.help_text: See rliger::createLiger().  Whether to remove cells not expressing any measured genes, and genes not expressed in any cells (if take.gene.union = TRUE, removes only genes not expressed in any dataset) (default TRUE).

integ_num_genes.description: Number of genes to find for each dataset.
integ_num_genes.help_text: See rliger::selectGenes(). Number of genes to find for each dataset. Optimises the value of var.thresh for each dataset to get this number of genes.

integ_combine.description: How to combine variable genes across experiments.

integ_capitalize.description: Capitalize gene names to match homologous genes.

integ_use_cols.description: Treat each column as a cell.

integ_k.help_text: See rliger::optimizeALS().  Inner dimension of factorization (number of factors). Run suggestK to determine appropriate value; a general rule of thumb is that a higher k will be needed for datasets with more sub-structure.

integ_lambda.help_text: See rliger::optimizeALS(). Regularization parameter. Larger values penalize dataset-specific effects more strongly (ie. alignment should increase as lambda increases). Run suggestLambda to determine most appropriate value for balancing dataset alignment and agreement (default 5.0).

integ_max_iters.description: Maximum number of block coordinate descent iterations.

integ_knn_k.description: Number of neearest neighbours for within-dataset knn graph.

integ_k2.description: Horizon parameter for shared nearest factor graph.
integ_k2.help_text: See rliger::quantileAlignSNF().  Distances to all but the k2 nearest neighbors are set to 0 (cuts down on memory usage for very large graphs).

integ_ref_dataset.description: Name of dataset to use as a reference.
integ_ref_dataset.help_text: See rliger::quantile_norm().  Name of dataset to use as a "reference" for normalization. By default, the dataset with the largest number of cells is used.

integ_min_cells.description: Minimum number of cells to consider a cluster shared across datasets.

integ_quantiles.description: Number of quantiles to use for normalization.

integ_nstart.description: Number of times to perform Louvain community detection.
integ_nstart.help_text: See rliger::quantileAlignSNF().  Number of times to perform Louvain community detection with different random starts (default 10).

integ_resolution.description: Controls the number of communities detected.

integ_dims_use.description: Indices of factors to use for shared nearest factor determination.

integ_dist_use.description: Distance metric to use in calculating nearest neighbour.

integ_center.description: Center the data when scaling factors.

integ_small_clust_thresh.help_text: See rliger::quantileAlignSNF().  Extracts small clusters loading highly on single factor with fewer cells than this before regular alignment (default 0 – no small cluster extraction).

integ_categorical_covariates.description: Categorical variables for integration report metrics.
integ_categorical_covariates.help_text: The integration report will provide plots and integration metrics for these categorical variables.

integ_input_reduced_dim.description: Reduced dimension embedding for the integration report.
integ_input_reduced_dim.help_text: The integration report will provide with and without integration plots using this embedding.

reddim_vars_to_regress_out.description: Variables to regress out before dimension reduction.

reddim_umap_n_neighbors.description: Number of nearest neighbours to use.

reddim_umap_n_components.description: The dimension of the space to embed into.
reddim_umap_n_components.help_text: See uwot::umap(). The dimension of the space to embed into. This defaults to 2 to provide easy visualization, but can reasonably be set to any integer value in the range 2 to 100.

reddim_umap_init.description: Type of initialization for the coordinates.

reddim_umap_metric.description: Distance metric for finding nearest neighbours.

reddim_umap_n_epochs.description: Number of epochs to us during optimization of embedded coordinates.

reddim_umap_learning_rate.description: Initial learning rate used in optimization of coordinates.

reddim_umap_min_dist.description: Effective minimum distance between embedded points.
reddim_umap_min_dist.help_text: See uwot::umap().  Smaller values will result in a more clustered/clumped embedding where nearby points on the manifold are drawn closer together, while larger values will result on a more even dispersal of points. The value should be set relative to the spread value, which determines the scale at which embedded points will be spread out.

reddim_umap_spread.help_text: See uwot::umap().  In combination with min_dist, this determines how clustered/clumped the embedded points are.

reddim_umap_set_op_mix_ratio.description: Interpolation to combine local fuzzy sets.
reddim_umap_set_op_mix_ratio.help_text: See uwot::umap().  The value of this parameter should be between 0.0 and 1.0; a value of 1.0 will use a pure fuzzy union, while 0.0 will use a pure fuzzy intersection.

reddim_umap_local_connectivity.help_text: See uwot::umap().  The local connectivity required – i.e. the number of nearest neighbors that should be assumed to be connected at a local level. The higher this value the more connected the manifold becomes locally.

reddim_umap_repulsion_strength.description: Weighting applied to negative samples in embedding optimization.
reddim_umap_repulsion_strength.help_text: See uwot::umap().  Weighting applied to negative samples in low dimensional embedding optimization. Values higher than one will result in greater weight being given to negative samples.

reddim_umap_negative_sample_rate.description: Number of negative edge samples to use per positive edge sample.
reddim_umap_negative_sample_rate.help_text: See uwot::umap().  The number of negative edge/1-simplex samples to use per positive edge/1-simplex sample in optimizing the low dimensional embedding.

reddim_umap_fast_sgd.help_text: See uwot::umap().  Setting this to TRUE will speed up the stochastic optimization phase, but give a potentially less accurate embedding, and which will not be exactly reproducible even with a fixed seed. For visualization, fast_sgd = TRUE will give perfectly good results. For more generic dimensionality reduction, it's safer to leave fast_sgd = FALSE.

reddim_tsne_initial_dims.description: Number of dimensions retained in the initial PCA step.

reddim_tsne_theta.help_text: See Rtsne::Rtsne().  Speed/accuracy trade-off (increase for less accuracy), set to 0.0 for exact TSNE (default: 0.5).

reddim_tsne_stop_lying_iter.description: Iteration after which perplexities are no longer exaggerated.
reddim_tsne_stop_lying_iter.help_text: See Rtsne::Rtsne().  Iteration after which the perplexities are no longer exaggerated (default: 250, except when Y_init is used, then 0).

reddim_tsne_mom_switch_iter.description: Iteration after which the final momentum is used.
reddim_tsne_mom_switch_iter.help_text: See Rtsne::Rtsne().  Iteration after which the final momentum is used (default: 250, except when Y_init is used, then 0).

reddim_tsne_pca_center.help_text: See Rtsne::Rtsne(). Should data be centered before pca is applied? (default: TRUE)

reddim_tsne_pca_scale.help_text: See Rtsne::Rtsne().  Should data be scaled before pca is applied? (default: FALSE).

reddim_tsne_normalize.help_text: See Rtsne::Rtsne(). Should data be normalized internally prior to distance calculations with normalize_input? (default: TRUE)

reddim_tsne_momentum.description: Momentum used in the first part of optimization.

reddim_tsne_final_momentum.description: Momentum used in the final part of optimization.

reddim_tsne_exaggeration_factor.description: Exaggeration factor used in the first part of the optimization.
reddim_tsne_exaggeration_factor.help_text: See Rtsne::Rtsne().  Exaggeration factor used to multiply the P matrix in the first part of the optimization (default: 12.0).

clustering.title: Clustering
clustering.description: Parameters used to tune louvain/leiden clustering.

clust_k.description: Integer number of nearest neighbours for clustering.
clust_k.help_text: Integer number of nearest neighbors to use when creating the k nearest neighbor graph for Louvain/Leiden clustering. k is related to the resolution of the clustering result, a bigger k will result in lower resolution and vice versa.

clust_louvain_iter.description: The number of iterations for clustering.

cell_type_annotation.title: Cell-type Annotation
cell_type_annotation.description: Parameters used for cell-type annotation and the associated report.

cta_unique_id_var.description: A sample metadata unique sample ID.

dge_min_counts.help_text: Only genes with at least min_counts in min_cells_pc will be tested for differential gene expression.

dge_min_cells_pc.help_text: Only genes with at least min_counts in min_cells_pc will be tested for differential gene expression.  Default 0.1 (i.e. 10% of cells).

dge_rescale_numerics.help_text: Re-scaling and centring numeric covariates in a model can improve model performance.

dge_pseudobulk.help_text: Perform differential gene expression on a smaller matrix where counts are first summed across all cells within a sample (defined by dge_sample_var level).

dge_celltype_var.help_text: Differential gene expression is performed separately for each cell-type of this colData variable.

dge_dependent_var.help_text: The dependent variable may be a categorical (e.g. diagnosis) or a numeric (e.g. histopathology score) variable.

dge_ref_class.help_text: If a categorical dependent variable is specified, then the reference class of the dependent variable is specified here (e.g. 'Control').
dge_ref_class.description: Reference class of categorical dependent variable.

dge_confounding_vars.help_text: A comma-separated list of confounding variables to account for in the DGE model.

dge_random_effects_var.help_text: If specified, the term `+ (1 | x ) +`is added to the model, where x is the specified random effects variable.

dge_fc_threshold.help_text: This absolute fold-change cut-off value is used in plots (e.g. volcano) and the DGE report.

dge_pval_cutoff.help_text: The adjusted p-value cutoff value is used in plots (e.g. volcano) and the DGE report.

dge_force_run.description: Force model fit for non-full rank.
dge_force_run.help_text: A non-full rank model specification will return an error; to override this to return a warning only, set to TRUE.

dge_max_cores.help_text: The default value of 'null' utilizes all available CPU cores.  As each additional CPU core increases the number of genes simultaneously fit, the RAM/memory demand increases concomitantly.  Manually overriding this parameter can reduce the memory demands of parallelization across multiple cores.

impacted_pathway_analysis.title: Impacted Pathway Analysis
impacted_pathway_analysis.description: Parameters for impacted pathway analysis of differentially expressed genes.

ipa_enrichment_database.help_text: See scFlow::list_databases().  Name of the database(s) for enrichment. Examples include "GO_Biological_Process", "GO_Cellular_Component", "GO_Molecular_Function", "KEGG", "Reactome", "Wikipathway".

dirichlet_modeling.title: Dirichlet Modeling
dirichlet_modeling.description: Parameters for dirichlet modeling of relative cell-type proportions.

dirich_ref_class.description: Reference class of categorical dependent variable.

dirich_var_order.help_text: For plotting and reports, the order of classes for the dependent variable can be manually specified (e.g. 'Control,Low,High').

reddimplot_pointsize.description: Point size for reduced dimension plots.
reddimplot_pointsize.help_text: To improve visualization the point size should be adjusted according to the total number of cells plotted.

reddimplot_alpha.description: Alpha (transparency) value for reduced dimension plots.
reddimplot_alpha.help_text: To improve visualization the alpha (transparency) value should be adjusted according to the total number of cells plotted.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: This works exactly as with `--email`, except emails are only sent if the workflow is not successful.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.
monochrome_logs.help_text: Set to disable colourful command line output and live life in monochrome.

tracedir.description: Directory to keep pipeline Nextflow logs and reports.

show_hidden_params.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested    for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.
custom_config_version.help_text:
Provide git commit id for custom Institutional configs hosted at `nf-core/configs`. This was implemented for reproducibility purposes. Default: `master`.

```bash
## Download and use config file with following git commit id
--custom_config_version d52db660777c4bf36546ddb188ec530c3ada1b96
```

custom_config_base.help_text:
If you're running offline, nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell nextflow where to find them with the `custom_config_base` option. For example:

```bash
## Download and unzip the config files
cd /path/to/my/configs
wget https://github.com/nf-core/configs/archive/master.zip
unzip master.zip

## Run the pipeline
cd /path/to/my/data
nextflow run /path/to/pipeline/ --custom_config_base /path/to/my/configs/configs-master/
```

> Note that the nf-core/tools helper package has a `download` command to download all required pipeline files + singularity containers + institutional configs in one go for you, to make this process easier.
